intro: Harpalyce cristalensis, commonly known as the crystalline harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Harpalyce cristalensis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
